data.title: A great Evening indeed.
data.text: Our visit was most enjoyable, the food was great, the service, and hospitality was beyond words.  We will come again and often.

data.title: Awesome!
data.text:
This has to be one of the best Mexican Restaurants in Southern
Calif!  The staff is friendly and really wants to make sure you are
having a great meal.  The chips come to the table hot!  The food tastes so good, you just want to stay there and have more.
There is outside dining as well.  Location is clean and appealing.
And, this really was an old bank and has lots of history!

data.title: Quick bite at the Outdoor Bar
data.text: So while walking in Old Town Temecula, I noticed the outdoor bar with a couple football games on so we net in for a quick beverage. We were greet ed immediately after seating ourselves with chips and salsa. I had their Cadillac margarita and it was fantastic. Strong AND smooth at the same time which isn't easy with a margarita. I also ordered a carne aside taco which was also very good and came with enough guacamole for two tacos so we used it with our chips. I literally have nothing negative to say about our experience. Great food, drinks and service.

owner_response.author: Christy P, Owner at The Bank - Mexican Restaurant & Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: One of a kind
data.text: Yes, this is in an old bank. Food, service and ambiance was great. I got the Tostada Supreme with carnitas for 11.95. Guests got shrimp salad; salad and tortilla soup and the car;nitas plate. Margaritas were really good also. Great location for going to the Temecula Theater.

owner_response.author: Christy P, Owner at The Bank - Mexican Restaurant & Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your review. Come back soon:)
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: The Bank
data.text: Nice meal in the heart of Old Temecula in an old bank building.  It was a good Mexican meal and nice to have the choice between refried or black beans.

owner_response.author: Christy P, Owner at The Bank - Mexican Restaurant & Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to write a nice review!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very good.   Awesome service
data.text:
Great location in Old Towne Temecula.   In an old bank building.    Worth a read about the thwarted bank robbery. 

Burritos were very good.    

Chips were a little thick for my taste.   

Sit outside and watch the world drift by.

data.title: Nice Location
data.text: Located on busy Front Street in Old Town Temecula, this restaurant has been around for a very long time. I first ate there in the late 1970's while traveling through to Lake Cuyamaca. I had wonderful things to say back then, but not this time. The best part of the visit was that we were promptly seated, but after that, it was all downhill. It took our server over 15 minutes to even acknowledge our presence, then another 10 to bring three glasses of water. The food we ordered took even longer, and what was supposed to be hot was lukewarm at best, while the cold item wasn't.  Getting someone to hand us the bill was an exercise in frustration. This was a very disappointing visit, and I doubt I will return.

data.title: Good Mexican in a historic former Bank building
data.text:
Right at the intersection of Main and Front Streets...Inside or Outside seating. Great homemade Guacamole....excellent Marghritas and generous portions. Reasonable pricing and good for an all around fun evening when you just want Mexican Food...Very casual atmosphere, clean and good service.
Ole...Enjoy!

data.title: Great food and location
data.text: Located in the heart of Old Town Temecula.  Great food and atmosphere.  Great service and reasonable prices.

data.title: Great Food and drinks
data.text: So, we've been here twice and have sat at the outside bar both times.  They do have indoor seating however. We just like the casualness of outside.  The margaritas are great!  So are the tostados and oh yes the guacamole!  We really enjoy the atmosphere, the drinks and the food here.  We will go back the next time we are in town!!

data.title: Avoid, better Mexican elsewhere.
data.text: Called in here on Sunday afternoon, have passed this place often and decided to try it out, service was good , drinks brought in good time, Chips and salsa, we're just OK, ordered Mahi Mahi  tough and tasteless, not even a hint of lemon juice. I had "shredded " chicken burrito. Very disappointing. Chicken was in big lumps , rather chopped than shredded, was mixed with large pieces of  chopped up onion and what was tinned tomatoes. Very dissatisfied, will not eat here again. There are many other restruants here to try, I am sure anywhere would have been better.

owner_response.author: Christy P, Owner at The Bank - Mexican Restaurant & Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: hmmmm. I'm a little confused by your tasteless Mahi Review.  Our Pescado is topped with a very favorable ranchero sauce.  Maybe you ordered the fish tacos which come with lime and cabbage, onion and cilantro. FYI you may always request a lemon wedge if you prefer.   I will discuss with my kitchen staff to shred the chicken more fine so other customers will not get the lumps.  So sorry you were dissatisfied.  We get many compliments on our chips and salsa and many other items on our menu.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: This place was not good
data.text: First off I will say the servers were friendly. That is the only good thing the place had going for it. The food was completely unremarkable and I won't be returning. Some of the worst Mexican food is I have ever had. The chile verde seems to be something they have in many dishes but the pork was totally dry. Just nothing about the place was better than below average. There are other better options like the Public House across the street. Stay away from this one if you like good Mexican food.

data.title: A Good Lunch at The Bank
data.text: My wife and I took a break from touring the wineries and decided to explore Old Town. We enjoyed walking around downtown. We then decided to eat at The Bank and we were glad we did. It has an open decor with a lot of pictures of the bank in its operation as a bank. They had a good variety of menu items. We chose the chicken enchilada dinners. The enchiladas were tasty along with the re-fried beans and Mexican rice. They also have a great salsa that we enjoyed with our chips. The service was friendly and fast. Afterward, we went into the vault and explored more of its history. We recommend The Bank for a good Mexican meal and a bit of history. Enjoy!

data.title: Good Mexican Food in Old Town Temecula
data.text:
Old Town - (modern) wooden sidewalks.  The ooold west.  Or something.  A nice place to spend a little time.  

We'd happened into town and just walked around until we found this place for dinner.  It's called The Bank because it once was, by available accounts, once a bank.  That's part of the place's charm.  

I had an enchilada (1 item of the possible 3 item combo) - beef with black beans, and my wife had the Carne Asada, rice and refried beans.  I tend to judge Mexican restaurants on my first visit by the taste of their salsa and their enchalada sauce.

At first, we were disappointed in the intensity of the salsa - and asked for something with a little more kick.  We were promptly given a large bowl of something with more kick that we mixed with the first, rather bland, style.  We were pleased with the result.

My wife made some sort of comment to the waiter about the chef's apparent salt-phobia or salt-consciousness that she felt had gone a bit beyond what was cautionary (breaking my rule about never saying anything even remotely negative to someone who has yet to deliver all the food to the table...).   It was a bit bland, but as I pointed out, that, unlike the "Chopped Kitchen" the tables at The Bank come replete with salt shakers.  Use them.  That worked.

The enchalada?  Maybe even 5 stars not the four.  The carne asada?  Same.  Great. Why the four stars instead of 5?   Ummmm...   as someone else on here commented: there's a restroom problem - or maybe it's a general Old Town problem since we noticed a sewage smell when we were walking on the sidestreet beneath "Luke's" rooftop bar and grill.   And I couldn't help but wonder if the...  unpleasant smell in the 'old bank's restroom is somehow connected.   You couldn't - could not - smell anything unpleasant in the restaurant proper, but the restroom was...  not up to par.

data.title: Good, not great
data.text:
Location, location, location!

A great choice when you are enjoying old town!

Food is good.  Service is good.  Seating and setting are great!

As a local, I would probably not go out of my way to eat here.

data.title: Truly fresh authentic Mexican
data.text:
Had a great meal here, food was 1st class & seemed everything was made on site, the salsa was fantastic as were the chips. I had beef & chicken burritos with rice & black beans, it was great, had that fresh taste, nothing out of a tin here. 
I thought due to the location it might be a little pricy, it was not. If you like  real Mexican food & are in the area give this place a try. I don't think you will be disappointed.

data.title: Great local restaurant!
data.text:
We have been here twice now and this last time they had Taco Tuesdays for $2. They have a great Pomegranate margarita that the tequila is infused with the pomegranate. Very good! The atmosphere is great because it used to be a bank 100 years ago and has nostalgia like the bank vault still there.
Best part the food is not pricey and good. Try the tamale! it is the best flavor.

data.title: Fun for bigger groups.
data.text:
This place is poplar and in a great location. 
I'm going to try it one more time. 
It's bigger than many of the smaller ones nearby that I really like.

data.title: A Great End to a Great Stay
data.text: My wife and I have been trying to attend a concert at one of the Temecula's local casino's at least once every 2 months. In doing so, we have also been searching out different places to stay and eat, tough job but someone has to do it.  We were recommended, The Bank, for great mexican food and we were not disappointed.  From the warm greeting at the door, to our knowledgeable and very personable server, to the wonderful tasting food, all combined to make it a very enjoyable evening. We will be back.  Suggestion: Nacho Supreme with chicken, it's awesome!!

owner_response.author: Christy P, Owner at The Bank - Mexican Restaurant & Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to write a great review.  We appreciate it:)
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great lunch & dinner
data.text: Ate dinner and had a margarita came back  for lunch the next day. That says it all! The patio seating was nice for our lunch.  Chips & salsa were good.  Service was excellent both at lunch & dinner.
